resource_dependency.background_image: Azure mist-themed background image or CSS gradient
resource_dependency.component_style: Dark slate blue themed components with appropriate contrast and accessibility considerations

function: Provide a responsive frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs.
static_description: The frontend application features a consistent Azure Mist background across all pages with Dark Slate Blue styled components such as buttons, cards, forms, and navigation menus. It includes navigation links to different sections: Dashboard, Send Message, User Profile, Policy Configuration, Monitoring, and Admin Panel.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on navigation links loads respective views dynamically via API calls without full page reloads.
UI adjusts responsively on window resize maintaining usability on mobile, tablet, and desktop screens.

resource_dependency.database_connection: PostgreSQL database connection using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp

function: Serve backend API endpoints and connect to PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables.
static_description: Backend server runs independently but communicates with the frontend through RESTful API endpoints. It establishes secure connections to the PostgreSQL database using provided credentials stored in environment variables.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon receiving requests from frontend, backend processes them by querying or updating the PostgreSQL database accordingly.

resource_dependency.session_store: Secure session storage mechanism (e.g., Redis or encrypted cookies)

function: Manage user authentication and maintain session states securely.
static_description: Login form displayed on access-restricted routes requiring username/email and password inputs along with optional 'Remember Me' checkbox.

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting login form sends credentials to backend which validates against stored user data and initiates a session upon success.
Clicking logout button invalidates current session and redirects user back to login screen.

function: Allow authenticated users to compose and send short messages specifying recipients and content.
static_description: Message composition area contains two main input fields labeled 'Recipient(s)' and 'Message Content', accompanied by a prominent 'Send' button. Recipient field supports multiple entries separated by commas.

interaction_and_states.description: Typing into recipient/content fields enables the send button when both contain valid input.
Clicking 'Send' submits message details to backend API endpoint for processing and delivery.

function: Display historical records of sent messages including timestamp, recipient, content, and status.
static_description: Dashboard presents a tabular view listing past messages with columns showing Timestamp, Recipient, Message Content preview, and Delivery Status. Pagination controls appear at bottom if needed.

interaction_and_states.description: Refreshing the dashboard re-fetches latest message history from backend API.
Clicking column headers sorts table rows ascending/descending based on selected attribute.

function: Enable users to view and update their personal information such as name, email, phone number, and avatar.
static_description: Profile section displays editable form pre-filled with existing user info including Name, Email, Phone Number, and Avatar upload option. Save and Cancel buttons positioned below form fields.

interaction_and_states.description: Editing any field activates save/cancel options allowing changes to be submitted or discarded.
Uploading new avatar triggers request to designated URL replacing previous image after successful upload.

function: Offer interface for administrators or authorized users to define message sending policies and limitations.
static_description: Configuration panel shows adjustable sliders or numeric inputs for parameters like daily maximum sends, per-minute rate limits, and allowed message length. Current values are shown alongside labels.

interaction_and_states.description: Changing slider/input value updates corresponding policy parameter temporarily until saved.
Saving applies updated policies globally affecting future message transmissions handled by backend logic.

resource_dependency.chart_library: Chart.js or similar library for rendering real-time graphs

function: Visualize live metrics related to SMS traffic including volume, success/failure rates, and latency.
static_description: Monitoring dashboard displays interactive charts representing real-time message throughput, delivery statuses over time, average response times, and top destinations. Charts auto-update periodically.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting date ranges or filtering criteria modifies chart datasets reflecting filtered statistical insights.
Hovering reveals tooltips detailing exact metric values at specific timestamps or categories.

resource_dependency.responsive_css_framework: TailwindCSS or Bootstrap configured for responsive layouts

function: Ensure complete UI responsiveness while applying consistent Azure Mist background and Dark Slate Blue component styling throughout.
static_description: All pages utilize responsive grid systems ensuring compatibility across devices. Background consistently uses Azure Mist color/image whereas primary interactive elements adopt Dark Slate Blue hues.

interaction_and_states.description: Rotating device switches between portrait and landscape modes adjusting layout fluidly.
Text and components scale appropriately during browser zoom preserving readability and aesthetics.

resource_dependency.db_schema_definition: Tables: users(id, name, email, role), messages(id, sender_id, recipients, content, status, created_at), policies(id, user_id, config), monitoring_logs(id, event_type, timestamp, metadata)

function: Define relational database schema to support core entities: users, messages, policies, and monitoring logs.
static_description: Database schema consists of four interconnected tables – users for account info, messages storing transmission details, policies holding rule configurations, and monitoring_logs capturing operational events.

function: Expose essential API endpoints enabling message submission, retrieval, and status modification.
static_description: RESTful endpoints available under '/api' prefix facilitating CRUD operations on messages. Endpoints follow standard HTTP methods aligned with resource-based naming conventions.

interaction_and_states.description: Sending POST to /api/messages/send triggers creation and dispatch of new message entry in system.
Fetching individual message via GET /api/messages/{id} returns detailed record including current status and audit trail.

function: Supply administrative tools for managing user accounts, roles, and associated permissions.
static_description: Admin interface lists registered users with ability to modify roles directly inline. Table includes columns like Username, Role, Last Active, and Actions (Edit/Delete).

interaction_and_states.description: Changing a user’s role updates their authorization level immediately impacting accessible features within app.
Deleting removes user permanently from system preventing further logins or actions unless recreated.

resource_dependency.structured_logger: Winston or Bunyan structured logging implementation

function: Implement centralized logging and robust error handling mechanisms to track failures during message delivery.
static_description: Internal logger captures exceptions, warnings, and informational traces generated by backend services. Error responses include unique IDs linking to extended context in persistent store.

interaction_and_states.description: Whenever internal failure occurs, relevant stack trace and contextual metadata logged asynchronously for later diagnostics.

resource_dependency.validation_rules: Zod/Joi/Yup schema definitions for validating message content, recipient formats, and policy constraints before persistence

function: Enforce strict validation checks on incoming message data, recipient specifications, and policy configurations prior to database commits.
static_description: Validation middleware intercepts every write operation checking compliance against predefined schemas covering acceptable lengths, character sets, and structural correctness.

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting malformed or out-of-bounds data results in immediate client-side feedback highlighting problematic fields with suggested corrections.

resource_dependency.dev_script_commands: concurrently "npm run dev --prefix frontend" "npm run dev --prefix backend"
resource_dependency.install_script_commands: npm install && cd frontend && npm install && cd ../backend && npm install

function: Configure package.json scripts to enable simultaneous installation and concurrent execution of frontend and backend development environments.
static_description: Root-level package.json defines custom commands 'install:all' and 'dev'. Running these executes nested installations and launches both apps concurrently using terminal multiplexers or process managers.

interaction_and_states.description: Executing 'npm run install:all' installs dependencies for entire monorepo structure whereas 'npm run dev' boots up integrated development servers side-by-side.
